meanings.definition: A former British gold coin worth one pound and one shilling.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used a guinea to buy expensive things.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather showed me a guinea coin from his collection.
meanings.sent3: The antique shop owner jokingly asked if I could pay with a guinea.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as rare and precious as a guinea coin.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the guinea caught the eye of the collector.

meanings.definition: A coastal region in West Africa.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful beaches in Guinea attract many tourists.
meanings.sent2: I dream of visiting the shores of Guinea one day.
meanings.sent3: The seagull flew all the way from Guinea for a vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like the waves of Guinea's coast.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in colors reminiscent of Guinea's landscapes.

meanings.definition: A breed of domesticated pig with a stocky build and short legs.
meanings.sent1: The guinea pig in the petting zoo was very friendly.
meanings.sent2: Children love to feed the guinea pigs at the farm.
meanings.sent3: The guinea pig wore a tiny crown for the animal parade.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as a guinea pig's will.
meanings.sent5: The guinea pig's squeaks filled the room with joy.
